meanings.definition: To make a formal judgment or decision.
meanings.sent1: The judge was adjudging the winner of the competition.
meanings.sent2: The court will be adjudging the case tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: Adjudging the best costume at the party was a tough task.
meanings.sent4: She was adjudging the quality of the artwork with a critical eye.
meanings.sent5: Adjudging the right path to take can be challenging in unfamiliar territory.

meanings.sent1: The principal was adjudging the student's award at the assembly.
meanings.sent2: The mayor will be adjudging the new city law next week.
meanings.sent3: Adjudging the cake as the tastiest in the bake-off brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent4: He was adjudging her as the most talented singer in the competition.
meanings.sent5: Adjudging the book as a masterpiece was a unanimous decision among critics.
